data.message: We don't *want* to have to use a second app. If it weren't for the annoying, constant red notification at the bottom of the Facebook app, I never would have bothered.

replies.message: Same here. We can easily just go to the browser on the phone to get our messages, but that constant notification is annoying.

My phone recognizes I'm trying to use the browser instead of the app and redirects my browser to the play store anyway- I can't bypass it anymore. 
So I have to use a severely outdated kindle that I didn't use for nearly two years to get FB messages. It's only a matter a time before those requests to update become mandatory or forced
Chrome with request desktop site doesn't work for you?
Use different browser than Google Chrome. I do and I have no problems using mobile website for messages.
Exactly, thier tactics and constant altering of Facebook are the reason I'm getting rid of mine.
